alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chittenden; Grand Isle (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:09PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Clinton, northeastern Essex, northwestern Addison, southern Grand Isle and Chittenden Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Willsboro, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, South Burlington, Burlington International Airport, Burlington, Willsboro, Winooski, Colchester, Essex Junction Village, Williston, St. George, Keeseville, Shelburne, Charlotte, South Hero, Port Kent, Richmond, Mt. Philo State Park, Jericho, Kingsland Bay State Park, and Essex. This includes the following highways... Interstate 87 between mile markers 127 and 138. Interstate 89 between mile markers 76 and 101. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern New York...and central and northwestern Vermont.
